intro: Grevea eggelingii, commonly known as the African ironwood tree, is a member of the Fabaceae family. It is native to sub-Saharan Africa and is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its strength and durability. The plant typically grows as a medium to large tree, reaching heights of up to 20 meters. Its leaves are bipinnate, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by elongated pods. Grevea eggelingii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important component of savanna ecosystems.
